intro: Jurinea amplifolia subsp. remotiloba, commonly known as the broad-leaved jurinea, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its succulent, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of white powder. The plant produces small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. It is adapted to harsh environmental conditions, with deep roots and a compact growth form to conserve water. This subspecies is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological resilience.
